author: Special Correspondent
text:
Punjabi folk singer Gurdas Maan performing at Lohri function of Punjab Association in Chennai on Sunday.— Photo: K. Pichumani

For over two hours on Sunday evening, popular singer Gurdas Maan took hundreds of the city’s Punjabis back to their home with his songs.

Traditional wooden cots (Chaarpai), carts laden with gunny bags and straw bales placed around the large grounds added to the atmosphere as his songs Dil da mamla hain and Challa filled the air.

The event was organised by Punjab Association, Chennai. Its president Bharat Bhushan Goyal presented Mr. Maan with the Punjab Di Shaan award.

Speaking at the annual Lohri celebrations at the Anna Adarsh College for Women in Anna Nagar, Mr. Maan said he remembered visiting the city in 1986 for the first time, when he recorded songs for Doordarshan Kendra Chennai.

On Chennai’s recent floods, he said he was pained to see the damage and devastation.
title: A taste of Punjab ahead of Lohri
